detaileddescription.para: The X and Y axes are always scaled by the same amount, so the ratio of their lengths remains constant.
The X and Y axes are allowed to vary independently of each other.
This is an enumeration of the different behaviors for the X and Y axes.
The Z axis is allowed to vary freely, independent of the other two axes.
The Z axis is held fixed and does not change.
The Z axis is always scaled in inverse proportion to the other two axes so the box volume remains fixed. Note that in this mode pressure has no effect on the system, only surface tension.
This is an enumeration of the different behaviors for Z axis.
This is the name of the parameter which stores the current pressure acting on the system (in bar).
This is the name of the parameter which stores the current surface tension acting on the system (in bar*nm).
This is the name of the parameter which stores the current temperature at which the system is being maintained (in Kelvin)

memberdef.argsstring: (double defaultPressure, double defaultSurfaceTension, double defaultTemperature, XYMode xymode, ZMode zmode, int frequency=25)
memberdef.name: MonteCarloMembraneBarostat

detaileddescription.para: Create a MonteCarloMembraneBarostat.

parameterdescription.para: the default pressure acting on the system (in bar)
the default surface tension acting on the system (in bar*nm)
the default temperature at which the system is being maintained (in Kelvin)
the mode specifying the behavior of the X and Y axes
the mode specifying the behavior of the Z axis
the frequency at which Monte Carlo volume changes should be attempted (in time steps)

detaileddescription.para: Get the default pressure acting on the system (in bar).

simplesect.para: the default pressure acting on the system, measured in bar.

detaileddescription.para: Set the default pressure acting on the system. This will affect any new Contexts you create, but not ones that already exist.

parameterdescription.para: the default pressure acting on the system, measured in bar.

detaileddescription.para: Get the default surface tension acting on the system (in bar*nm).

simplesect.para: the default surface tension acting on the system, measured in bar*nm.

detaileddescription.para: Set the default surface tension acting on the system. This will affect any new Contexts you create, but not ones that already exist.

parameterdescription.para: the default surface tension acting on the system, measured in bar.

detaileddescription.para: Get the frequency (in time steps) at which Monte Carlo volume changes should be attempted. If this is set to 0, the barostat is disabled.
Set the frequency (in time steps) at which Monte Carlo volume changes should be attempted. If this is set to 0, the barostat is disabled.
Get the default temperature at which the system is being maintained, measured in Kelvin.
Set the default temperature at which the system is being maintained. This will affect any new Contexts you create, but not ones that already exist.

parameterdescription.para: the system temperature, measured in Kelvin.

detaileddescription.para: Get the mode specifying the behavior of the X and Y axes.
Set the mode specifying the behavior of the X and Y axes.
Get the mode specifying the behavior of the Z axis.
Set the mode specifying the behavior of the Z axis.
Get the random number seed. See setRandomNumberSeed() for details.

Set the random number seed. It is guaranteed that if two simulations are run with different random number seeds, the sequence of Monte Carlo steps will be different. On the other hand, no guarantees are made about the behavior of simulations that use the same seed. In particular, Platforms are permitted to use non-deterministic algorithms which produce different results on successive runs, even if those runs were initialized identically.

If seed is set to 0 (which is the default value assigned), a unique seed is chosen when a Context is created from this Force. This is done to ensure that each Context receives unique random seeds without you needing to set them explicitly.
Returns whether or not this force makes use of periodic boundary conditions.

simplesect.para: true if force uses PBC and false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: When a Context is created, it invokes this method on each Force in the System. It should create a new ForceImpl object which can be used by the context for calculating forces. The ForceImpl will be deleted automatically when the Context is deleted.

This is a Monte Carlo barostat designed specifically for membrane simulations. It assumes the membrane lies in the XY plane. The Monte Carlo acceptance criterion includes a term to model isotropic pressure, which depends on the volume of the periodic box, and a second term to model surface tension, which depends on the cross sectional area of the box in the XY plane. Note that pressure and surface tension are defined with opposite senses: a larger pressure tends to make the box smaller, but a larger surface tension tends to make the box larger.
There are options for configuring exactly how the various box dimensions are allowed to change:

listitem.para: The X and Y axes may be treated isotropically, in which case they always scale by the same amount and remain in proportion to each other; or they may be treated anisotropically, in which case they can vary independently of each other.
The Z axis can be allowed to vary independently of the other axes; or held fixed; or constrained to vary in inverse proportion to the other two axes, so that the total box volume remains fixed.

detaileddescription.para: This class assumes the simulation is also being run at constant temperature, and requires you to specify the system temperature (since it affects the acceptance probability for Monte Carlo moves). It does not actually perform temperature regulation, however. You must use another mechanism along with it to maintain the temperature, such as LangevinIntegrator or AndersenThermostat.
